channel.title: A bit of GUI help please :)
channel.description:
Well, I need a bit of help...
I'm writing a GUI for [u][url=http://www.jibble.org/pircbot.php]PircBot[/url][/u] and basically I need a bit of help with JTabbedPane. I need to split all the text from different channels into different tabs, and be able to dynamically add or remove tabs. Can anybody please help? A typical message is [code]<user's address thing> <command (we use PRIVMSG)> <channel> :<message>[/code]
My program sauce can be found @ http://pastebin.ca/291716
If you need anymore souces, just tell me...
Thanks in advance, ~ilyaostr9 (io9)

item.title: A bit of GUI help please :)
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

ilyaostr9:

@moparisthebest, Which class is that?

com.mopar.textedit.JJavaEditor

Read full topic
item.source: A bit of GUI help please :)

item.title: A bit of GUI help please :)
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:41318”][quote author=ilyaostr9 link=topic=55161.msg710211#msg710211 date=1167512491]

Look at SIDE, the class I wrote to make a tabbed text editor should actually be identical to what you are doing, if you need help with it just ask.

Yeh, I was thinking of doing that, but I need a way to sort out and reformat the texh that comes in.

Here’s an example of a log entry:
:ilyaostr9!i=ofhku@ PRIVMSG #firefox :me io9bot r here

Now I need it to only get my nick. and store the address to a LinkedList, in case we need to kick him, ban him, etc. (LinkedList, so that he can leave and enter dynamically)
So I need to reformat it to this “let’s pretend this is the #firefox channel tab”
me io9Bot r here
or if it were a NOTICE, it would be in the “Notices tab” like so:
Notice: NOTICE THIS LOL

Help, pls, thx…
[/quote]
you fkin moron i told you 3 times look at my damn source its exactly what you want[/quote]
I can’t figure how the fuck to read java so I’m a noob, tell me what java script i should look at. plzplzplzplz help
JK

Yeah, Ima check you thing out…

@moparisthebest, Which class is that?

Read full topic

Help, pls, thx…

item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

How about make your own JPanel subclass and stick the JTextArea and whatever other shit you need in it. Hell, call it “ChannelPanel”. It even rhymes.

String : channelName
JTextArea: Text area for that channel

item.title: A bit of GUI help please :)
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

newbiehacker:

I use HashMap plx.

Please elaborate what for…[br][size=1]Posted on: December 29, 2006, 03:24:17 PM[/size][hr][quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:39308”]find the channel name. make a class named tab, and thats what you will be adding to the tab pane, and each one shel hav a text area, and just .append to it. store tabs in an array. WHY ONT YOU JUST LOOK AT MY FKIN SOURCE[/quote]
If I store tabs in an array, how would I dynamically remove or add them without creating a whole new Array. I am, however gonna use a LinkedList to store the tabs…

Read full topic
